intro: Lomaria capensis, commonly known as the Cape lomaria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in a rounded head. Lomaria capensis is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
